alert.note: Alert for Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 26 at 2:44PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MDT FOR SOUTHERN SANTA FE AND NORTH CENTRAL TORRANCE COUNTIES... At 242 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near McIntosh, or 8 miles southeast of Moriarty, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Areas southeast of Moriarty including Clements Road and Ansley Ranch Road. Large hail will impact Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 199 and 210. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN
info.instruction: Motorists should not take shelter under highway overpasses. If you cannot safely drive away from the tornado, as a last resort, either park your vehicle and stay put, or abandon your vehicle and lie down in a low lying area and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
